title: Jaroslav Boroš
text:
Jaroslav Boroš (born 1 January 1947 in <a href="Vranov%20nad%20Top%C4%BEou">Vranov nad Topľou</a>, <a href="Czechoslovakia">Czechoslovakia</a>) is a former <a href="Slovakia">Slovak</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> who played for his hometown club Vranov nad Topľou and since his 18 years for <a href="MFK%20Ko%C5%A1ice">VSS Košice</a> from 1965 to 1977. He played overall 236 matches and scored 45 goals during his career at the <a href="Czechoslovak%20First%20League">Czechoslovak First League</a>.
Boroš made one appearance for the <a href="Czechoslovakia%20national%20football%20team">Czechoslovakia national football team</a> against <a href="Spain%20national%20football%20team">Spain</a> in the <a href="UEFA%20Euro%201968%20qualifying">UEFA Euro 1968 qualifying</a> loss 1-2 at <a href="Santiago%20Bernab%C3%A9u%20Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu Stadium</a>. He also played for <a href="Czechoslovakia%20at%20the%201968%20Summer%20Olympics">Czechoslovakia at the 1968 Summer Olympics</a> and for the Czechoslovakia national under-23 team.
